image.alt: Smiling patients at an orthodontic practice

paragraphs.text: Thank you for visiting the website of Derek Damon Orthodontics, the office of Derek R. Damon, DDS. We offer orthodontic treatment in Bellingham and Anacortes, Washington, and our top priority is to provide the highest quality orthodontic care in a friendly, comfortable environment.

We utilize the latest technological advancements, including digital imaging and advanced computer planning, and offer many treatment options for adults, adolescents, and children. Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions about our offices or services.

items.title: Faster Treatment
items.text: We use advanced systems and digital treatment planning that can shorten overall treatment time while delivering predictable results.

items.title: Fewer Appointments
items.text: Self-ligating brackets and a digital workflow reduce the number of in-office visits you’ll need during treatment.

items.title: More Comfortable
items.text: Modern mechanics, lighter wires, and clear aligner options focus on comfort throughout your treatment.

items.title: Personalized Options
items.text: We offer Damon braces, Spark and Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, and individualized plans for children, teens, and adults.

paragraphs.text: Derek R. Damon, DDS, is an accredited orthodontic specialist who has been creating confident smiles since 2001. He earned his dental degree and completed his orthodontic residency at the University of Washington and brings advanced post‑doctoral orthodontic training to his practices in Bellingham and Anacortes. Dr. Damon is an active member of the American Association of Orthodontists and the Pacific Coast Society of Orthodontists, committed to evidence‑based care and ongoing continuing education.
We provide Damon braces, Spark and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, early orthodontic care, and comprehensive treatment for teens and adults — all planned with modern digital tools.

image.alt: Child smiling during early orthodontic visit

testimonials.author: Safia Mohammed
testimonials.testimonial: “I’m so happy I chose Derek Damon Orthodontics for my clear aligners! Doctor Damon made me feel comfortable and addressed all my questions and concerns. Everyone in the office is so friendly and kind.”

testimonials.author: Mikayla Chang
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Damon and his staff are friendly, professional, and excellent at their jobs. Dr. Damon listened to my wishes regarding the type of orthodontic device and the timeline for correction. He helped me achieve my goals in a timely manner.”

testimonials.author: Ace Shahan
testimonials.testimonial: “I've been going to this orthodontist for 10 years for multiple treatments. And I have never had a bad experience with Dr. Damon and his staff. Overall after my treatment, I'm happier, more confident.”

image.alt: Parents with kids relaxing in front of home

og_meta.title: Home - Derek Damon Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Derek Damon Orthodontics provides Damon braces, clear aligners, and personalized orthodontic care in Bellingham and Anacortes, WA.

image.alt: Dr. Derek Damon greeting a patient in the Derek Damon Orthodontics office

paragraphs.text: At Derek Damon Orthodontics our priority is delivering high-quality, personalized orthodontic care in a welcoming, comfortable setting. We combine modern technology with a patient-first approach to make treatment predictable and efficient.

We emphasize faster treatment times and fewer appointments through digital planning and advanced systems such as the Damon System and clear aligner options like Spark and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> when appropriate, so patients spend less time in the chair and more time enjoying their new smiles.

Every treatment plan is tailored to an individual’s goals, growth pattern, and lifestyle. Our team focuses on comfort, clear communication, and gentle mechanics to create stable, long-lasting results.

Serving Bellingham and Anacortes since 2001, we pair steady clinical experience with continuing education and modern workflows to make quality orthodontics accessible and convenient for families and adults in our community.

Dr. Derek R. Damon, DDS, is a board-certified orthodontic specialist serving Bellingham and Anacortes. An accredited orthodontist, he completed advanced post-doctoral orthodontic training accredited by the American Dental Association and has been in practice since 2001. Dr. Damon focuses on treatment that balances biology, comfort, and efficiency to help patients achieve healthy, confident smiles.

image.alt: Dr. Derek Damon smiling in clinic

paragraphs.text: Dr. Damon earned his Doctor of Dental Surgery from the University of Washington and completed his specialty orthodontic residency there. He maintains active memberships in the American Association of Orthodontists, the Pacific Coast Society of Orthodontists, and the American Dental Association, and he pursues continuing education to stay current with AAO guidelines and modern techniques.

image.alt: Dr. Damon at a continuing education event

paragraphs.text: A sixth-generation orthodontist in his family, Dr. Damon blends a legacy of clinical experience with modern, digital workflows. He is experienced with the Damon System, Spark aligners, and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> treatment planning, using 3D imaging and low-friction mechanics to create efficient, comfortable treatment plans tailored to each patient.
Outside the office he is committed to community service and ongoing education, and he values clear communication so patients understand their treatment choices and expected outcomes.

image.alt: Dr. Damon consulting with a patient

slides.alt: Treatment room with modern orthodontic equipment
Digital imaging equipment and operatory technology
Waiting area and office interior at Derek Damon Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Derek Damon Orthodontics has served the Bellingham and Anacortes communities since 2001. We support local schools, youth sports, and community health initiatives when possible, and we welcome opportunities to partner with organizations that expand access to dental and orthodontic care.

og_meta.title: About Us | Derek Damon Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Technology-driven, patient-focused orthodontic care in Bellingham and Anacortes with Dr. Derek Damon.

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at Lakeshore Orthodontics front desk

paragraphs.text: Every smile starts with a new patient exam. Your initial consultation includes a complete oral exam and digital X-rays, plus time to meet Dr. Derek Damon and our team so we can discuss treatment options tailored to you, including Damon braces and Invisalign<sup>®</sup>.
We’ll review your medical history, create a customized treatment plan, and explain timeline, costs, insurance, and payment options so you leave with clear next steps and confidence in your care.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will file your claims electronically for maximum convenience.
Flexible payment plans are available, and our treatment coordinator will help you find an option that fits your budget.
Before your visit, please complete any new patient information online and gather prior dental records if you have them. When you’re ready, use our appointment request form to book a consultation.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

paragraphs.text: The Damon System uses self-ligating, tie-less brackets with lighter wires to move teeth comfortably and efficiently. Patients often experience fewer adjustments and a gentler feel compared with traditional techniques.
Damon Clear offers a more tooth‑colored bracket option for patients who want the performance of self‑ligating braces with a less noticeable appearance.

image.alt: Smiling adult patient after orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: Spark aligners are a clear, removable option that straighten teeth with a series of custom trays. They offer discreet treatment and let you eat and clean normally during therapy.

Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners are virtually invisible, removable trays that use advanced 3D imaging to move teeth precisely. They are a convenient option for adults and teens seeking discreet treatment.

image.alt: Close-up of a clear aligner on a model

paragraphs.text: Metal braces remain a reliable and cost‑effective choice for many bite and alignment issues. Small brackets and wires gently move teeth into the planned positions over time.
Ceramic braces offer a tooth‑colored alternative to metal brackets for patients who want effective treatment with a more discreet look.
Phase 1 or early treatment can guide jaw growth and correct developing problems. Starting as early as age seven, timely intervention may simplify or shorten later treatment.

We evaluate TMJ concerns with a physical exam, diagnostic imaging, and bite analysis, then recommend personalized care. Options can include appliances, orthodontics with braces or aligners, jaw exercises, and ongoing monitoring.

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about braces, clear aligners, elastics, oral hygiene, retainers, treatment time, breakage, pregnancy, sports, and eating at Derek Damon Orthodontics.

accordion.header: Do they numb your mouth when you get braces?

paragraphs.text: Numbing is not usually necessary for placing braces. You may feel pressure or brief discomfort during the appointment; topical numbing gel can be used if needed to reduce sensitivity.

accordion.header: How long do I have to wear braces?

paragraphs.text: Treatment time varies by case and appliance. Typical ranges are: traditional braces 18–24 months, Damon System braces 12–18 months, and clear aligners (Spark or Invisalign<sup>®</sup>) 12–18 months. We provide a personalized timeline at your consultation.

accordion.header: What should I do if a bracket or wire breaks?

paragraphs.text: Call our office as soon as possible to schedule a repair. In the meantime, use orthodontic wax to cover sharp edges and avoid sticky or hard foods that could worsen the damage.
Yes. Flossing every day is essential to prevent decay and gum disease. Use floss threaders, pre-threaded flossers, or a water flosser to clean under wires and between teeth.

accordion.header: Why do my teeth hurt when I first start wearing elastics?

paragraphs.text: Soreness comes from tooth movement and inflammation of the supporting ligament. It usually peaks within 24 hours and then eases. Change elastics several times a day as prescribed to keep forces consistent.

accordion.header: Can I eat fast food while wearing braces?

paragraphs.text: Some fast-food items can damage braces. Avoid hard, crunchy, or sticky foods. Choose softer options, cut food into small pieces, and be mindful to protect brackets and wires.

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

accordion.header: Can I still play sports with braces?

paragraphs.text: Yes. We recommend a custom mouthguard for contact or high-impact sports to protect your teeth and orthodontic appliances.

accordion.header: Will people notice my orthodontic treatment?

paragraphs.text: Clear aligners are nearly invisible, and modern bracket systems are smaller and more discreet than older styles. Many patients choose aligners for a lower-profile look.

accordion.header: Can I start orthodontic treatment while pregnant?

paragraphs.text: In most cases you can begin or continue orthodontic care, but consult both your medical provider and our team. Pregnancy hormones can affect gum health and X-rays are taken with appropriate precautions when necessary.

accordion.header: How long do retainers last and what about relapse?

paragraphs.text: Teeth can shift over time; long-term or nighttime retainer wear is commonly recommended to maintain results. Minor relapse may be corrected with limited retreatment, often faster than the original treatment.
